alert.note: Alert for Iberia; Lafayette; Lower St. Martin; St. Landry; St. Mary; Upper St. Martin; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Iberia, southeastern Lafayette, northwestern St. Mary, east central Vermilion, St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Martinville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Iberia, Catahoula, Breaux Bridge, Franklin, St. Martinville, Jeanerette, Cypremort Point, Avery Island, Broussard, Youngsville, Baldwin, Erath, Delcambre, Henderson, Loreauville, Butte La Rose, Lydia, Acadiana Regional Airport, Atchafalaya National Wildlife Refuge and Jefferson Island. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 111 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for south central, central and southwestern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Iberia; Lafayette; Lower St. Martin; St. Landry; St. Mary; Upper St. Martin; Vermilion
